wikipedia_page.main: James Millar (2 March 1870 – 5 February 1907) was a Scottish footballer who played for Sunderland, Rangers and the Scotland national football team as a forward.

response: In their first three league titles, Johnny Campbell was the top scorer of the league. Also notable in the attack at the time, and important to Campbell's success in attack, were other "Team of all Talents" players Jimmy Hannah and Jimmy Millar. As goalkeeper, Ned Doig set a 19th-century world record by not conceding any goals in 87 of his 290 top division appearances (30%).https://iffhs.de/history-curiosities-of-world-football-1891-1900/
* 2 March – Jimmy Millar (d. 1907), Scotland international forward in three matches. scoring two goals; won a total of six domestic league titles playing for Rangers and Sunderland.

Sunderland striker, the Scot John Campbell, became league top scorer three times, in all of which Sunderland won the league. Important to his success in attack were other "Team of All Talents" players from Scotland: Jimmy Hannah and Jimmy Millar. Their goalkeeper Ned Doig set a 19th-century world record by not conceding any goals in 87 of his 290 top division appearances (30%).

link_mentions.page: List of Rangers F.C. international footballers

response: Sunderland striker, the Scot John Campbell, became league top scorer three times, in all of which Sunderland won the league. Important to his success in attack were other "Team of All Talents" players from Scotland: Jimmy Hannah and Jimmy Millar. Their goalkeeper Ned Doig set a 19th-century world record by not conceding any goals in 87 of his 290 top division appearances (30%).
* Jimmy Millar (footballer, born 1870) (1870–1907), Scottish footballer who played for Sunderland and the Scotland national team
* Jimmy Millar (footballer, born 1876) (1876–1932), Scottish footballer who played for Middlesbrough, Bradford City and Aberdeen
* Jimmy Millar (footballer, born 1934), Scottish footballer who played for Rangers and the Scotland national team
